Reviews.Title: “A New Year getaway at The Gateway”
Reviews.Author: LinSouthYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We went to see family in London for New Year and stayed for 4 nights at The Gateway Hotel. It was only 5 minutes walk from Clapham South Tube Station. It is also a pleasant walk along from Clapham Common Tube Station too. Our room, number 17, in the newer extension, was modern, clean and comfortable and the staff were polite and friendly. Breakfast wasn't available during our stay, but we took a 10 minute walk down to Wetherspoon's Moon under Water at Balham for breakfast. There are also several cafes there and it has convenient tube and train stations too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: Julesnoir
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the beds were comfortable but DO NOT BOOK IF YOU ARE DISABLED. My partner is disabled and we requested a ground floor room, unfortunately the only disabled room they had was unavailable and my partner had to struggle up 2 flights of stairs. As we were only staying one night we just put up with it but it did mean we couldn't leave the room until we were leaving. Good hotel if you if you want somewhere cheap and near the tube station.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Balham”
Reviews.Author: TonyWebUk
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights here recently as it was convenient for a family visit. It is close to shops, cafes and restaurants and the underground. Very friendly receptionist and we were allowed to leave luggage in our room though we were very early in arriving. At £80 per night for a twin this was not cheap. This did not include breakfast as they were 'short staffed.' We were asked to pay on arrival as reception was not always staffed: in fact, after check in we saw no staff at all though the room was serviced. We were shown a side door which we were asked to use for entry and exit and just dropped keys in a box on departure. The room was serviceable but the chair was worn, the carpet had a hole in it and the wash basin was cracked. The hotel is close to Balham Hill which is a very busy road so were kept awake by traffic noise, frequwnr sirens and loud voices in the street. On these grounds we would not reuse.

Reviews.Title: “amanda”
Reviews.Author: Amzz W
Reviews.Content: great location stayed here for two nights in October , very freindly near the clapham south underground located near shops, i enjoyed my stay here it was very reasonable especially for London would highly reccomend . On a busy road but london is busy great location would definatly stay here again many thanks for a great stay at a lovely freindly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location + clean room”
Reviews.Author: pelcia
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a cheap hotel in London for one night. Although some reviews found in the Internet were negative I decided to book this hotel. I enjoyed my stay. All was great. The most important that it was close to the Tube station and the room and bathroom were clean. Good location and value for London. The hotel is 10 min walk from the Tube; Bus Stop is right in front of the hotel. The hotel was very easy to find. The room wasn't huge but served its purpose, and was very clean. The bathroom rather small but clean. Nice area with places to eat and parks; many stores within walking distance. No complaints really.

Reviews.Title: “"Well located and very considerate staff"”
Reviews.Author: onemilejorg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a number of times over 6 weeks as a base for UK and further European travel. A small hotel very conveniently located a short walk from Clapham South Underground. Excellent and very considerate staff did agreat job. On a busy road, however this is just part of the city buzz and the plus is a number of shops, cafes and small supermarkets nearby. The rooms were clean with good facilities and the hotel felt safe. As in many places the WIFi was of variable quality in different rooms, more reliable in the reception area.

Reviews.Title: “it was fine”
Reviews.Author: gayek209953
Reviews.Content: stayed while over for daughters graduation-room was grand. did not see many staff but was out and about all day. not as noisy as i expected from reviews although my room ws at back. i would go back-good value for clapham.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: kbruce58
Reviews.Content: Not so quiet area but great locale for London. Excellent public transport at door. Clean rooms and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal”
Reviews.Author: TravellerWirral
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this hotel and it was even better than the first. We had a small but perfect double room, beautifully clean and comfortable. The staff on reception was very helpful. There is no lounge and a continental breakfast is not included but can be booked. The tube is a hop, skip and a jump away and bus' stop outside. Clapham Common is on the doorstep as are any number of bars/restaurants. Having reading some bad reviews I wonder if they got the wrong hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: maryhd21
Reviews.Content: Worst experience ever! Disgusting! Woke up at 3.30am with bedbugs biting me and crawling all over the bed. Killed many, leaving blood stains on the sheet. Nobody in reception till 8.30am, when I told manager what happened and showed him the dead bugs and blood on the sheets, he didn't apologize, would't refund my money, just treated me as if somehow it was MY fault. He even said " You've been complaining since you arrived." I suppose he was referring to the room key and tv that didn't work, the heat that wasn't on...I finally recvd a sort of apology by phone and a refund cheque from him because after he called the pest control he found out that I was not making the whole thing up. I had an allergic reaction to the dozens of bites all over my body and face that lasted for 3 weeks, in fact while writing this, I still have scars from the bites.

Reviews.Title: “Not even worth the cheap price”
Reviews.Author: ppsg69
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room for this hotel two months before staying. At no stage up until arrival did we have any clue this would not be the case. On arriving we were given the key to a twin room, when we questioned this we were told it was all they had, and gave no apology for not giving us what we booked. Things got worse when we got to the room. It was freezing, there was no heating apart from a little portable electric heater, which hadn't been turned on in advance, and had little effect on the room when it did. Added to this was the noise - good double/triple1-glazing might have helped keep the noise from the busy (24hours a day) road and rail line out, but this wasn't there. Neither was any net curtaining, so unless we closed the curtains and pitched the room into gloom we were on display to the world. Reception could offer nothing to help so we left.

Reviews.Title: “Location and price”
Reviews.Author: sarne
Reviews.Content: Since our daugther works and lives nearby we needed to find a suitable place; i.e. location and price was important. We also needed the nearness to the tube and buses. Gateway Hotel fitted the bill alright since the tube is around 150 meters away and bus 155 (towards Clapham Common) stops just outside the hotel. We had a twin room (no 18) that was nicely outfitted with a waterheater, coffe /tea and some standard cakes. The beds were ok, but a little bit soft. Everything was clean and nice. Traffic noice from the tube and the traffic on Balham Hill was not that very disturbing but noticeable. There is a Marks&Spencer and a Tesco just up the street and an ATM across the road at the gas-station. We would definetly go back again if we need to.

HotelInfo.Name: The Gateway Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 14 Balham Hill | Clapham Common, London SW12 9EB, England
